column2: Number and percentage of public school students retained in grade 7, by race/ethnicity, disability status, and English proficiency, by state: School Year 2013-14

column18: Students With Disabilities Served Under IDEA
column20: Students With Disabilities Served Only Under Section 504

column8: Hispanic or Latino of any race
column14: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

column2: NOTE: Table reads (for US Totals):  Of all 33,396 public school students retained in grade 7, 371 (1.1%) were American Indian or Alaska Native, 4,836 (14.5%) were students with disabilities served under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA), and 1,370 (4.1%) were students with disabilities served solely under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973.
The ‘1 to 3’ reference indicates that the data have been suppressed based on the schools’ reported n-size, and that a midpoint was used to calculate the total.
Data reported in this table represent 100.0% of responding schools.

SOURCE: U.S. Department of Education, Office for Civil Rights, Civil Rights Data Collection, 2013-14, available at http://ocrdata.ed.gov. Data notes are available on the Data Notes page, under Additional Resources at http://ocrdata.ed.gov/DataNotes.
